name: Pesto Genovese (Authentic Italian Basil Pesto)
author: MadameDanielaMoscaToba
summary: An authentic Genoese pesto. It's straight from Italy and you won't find a better recipe! This calls for a spoonful of pecorino cheese, but you could also use all Parmesan in a pinch. To store in fridge for up to 1 month: place pesto in a jar, cover with olive oil, and top with a lid.
ingredients: 2 cloves garlic, or more to taste
1 ½ tablespoons grated pecorino Romano cheese
directions: Crush garlic using a mortar and pestle
Add pine nuts; crush with the garlic
Add basil leaves gradually, making circular movements with the pestle, until a smooth paste forms
Mix Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese and pecorino Romano cheese using a wooden spoon
Stir in olive oil until pesto is blended
